comment.text: I enjoyed the food here. I will say that it's kinda uncomfortable sitting in the small seats at the small tables. And when I went, it was soooooo hot inside. The waitress said their AC system was on, but it's old. Overall, I would definitely come back here again, I just hope it won't be so hot and small inside.

Dinner with the wife and mother in law a couple of days before Christmas. For a chain Thai restaurant, this was damn good. 

Started with the coconut milk soup with chicken and love it. This soup was excellent - a bit spicy but far from overwhelming and chock full of flavor. 

For my entree, I went with the minced chicken chef speciality. While the dish was great, there was entirely too much soy. If we were out west, we'd be in trouble because there isn't enough water left in the Colorado river to hydrate me after this dinner. Still, it was very good. 

My biggest complaint and I almost took another star away for it is the 20% auto grat for 3 people. How obnoxious can you get?  I understand auto gratuities for large parties or maybe busy nights  was unbelievably obnoxious. Service was great but for 3 people?  And 20% is obnoxious. When did we get to a point that 20% ceased to be for outstanding service and is now somehow a minimum?  It is your responsibility as a business owner to pay your employees a decent wage, but if their pay is based on gratuities than the tip is going to match the level of service. I have no problem tipping but hitting me with an automatic 20% instead of simply paying your employees more is robbery. 

An auto-gratuity should be a minimum that I can add to if I want.  It should never be at the level for excellent service and not on a party of 3 people. As much as I enjoyed this meal, that policy will keep me from coming back.

Ok , This was always on my collections list and we decided to try it out . I walked in with no expectations , But We definitely walked into a vibe . It dark , but its a chill vibe, nice decor, i dont really like the seating because its too close together , i can hear the next persons conversation. And im nosey soooooo yea , lol . The service was good, our waitress was sweet. The food was good, i had the drunken noodles. We really enjoyed our bottled water, made us feel boujee. All in all id give it 7/10.

Thai 26 is always a hit. The food is consistently tasty whether I'm in person or I have ordered delivery. My favorites to name a few are the Rama Chicken, dumplings, massaman curry with roti and the skewers. 

The service has been great, I've had lots of friend dates here and Introduced some who have never been. They have always loved it! 

The drink list does differ from their other location. I learned this the hard way. But both have something yummy to offer. 

The ambiance is chill, you can have a business lunch or date here and you can hear your guests speak ... in between taking bites of their great food.

Beware!!!   They force TIP an 18% "ServiceTip" on the bill.   No optimg out even after tequesting it!!!    Nevermind,   that they still ask for a separate "Tip" at checkout.   Interesting tactic they play out at this place.    Not coming back for sure,  and whole lots of people to follow my helpful review!   C- Yaaa!!!
Really loved this spot. Not only was the good delicious but the ambiance of the restaurant was wonderful.
Love the ambiance and great patio sitting. Great service. I recommend their fried rice.  10 out 10!!

26 Thai will FOREVER be one of my fave Thai Restaurants in Atlanta. The food is consistently good. I've eaten a lot of things off of the menu and have yet to have a bad dish! The appetizers sampler is a must, I believe you can select 3 apps! The Sweet Chili Wings and The Crab & Cheese rolls are my fave. Also, if you see the 5hour braised short rib on the menu....ORDER IT! You can get it in a noodle dish but my fave is served with  yellow curry and eggplant with a side of steamed rice! I've been to all of the locations but the one on Juniper is my new fave! I'll be back as soon as I can find an excuse to eat good again lol
Fair pricing for really good food. Nice, homey ambiance if the music isn't too loud (they can adjust it). Will go back!

I've been here twice now, and it's fantastic. The outdoor seating in the summer time is lovely and all the apps and soups are a must. I usually get either the panang or green curry, but they are both so yummy. 10/10 would recommend and can't wait to go back!
They get everything right! We had tapas and everything was good! Hands down top 3 thai places i've ever tasted.

Everything good. Only leaving this review because I was telling someone how good the food is. The hardest part is seeing other peoples plates and having fake buyers remorse. Because... (first sentence)

I came here very last minute looking for Asian food that had outdoor seating and would allow my dog. This place fit the bill. I need to start off with parking - finding somewhere to park is a pain here. Maybe it was just because it was mother's day (I'm not from Atlanta) but it was difficult. I eventually found a spot in the lot near the restaurant and it can get expensive especially if you are at the restaurant for a while. 

On to the service - the hostess was kind and immediately sat my boyfriend and I at a table outside where my pup just laid on the floor. Our waitress was sub-par. She would take a while to get back to us yet was more attentive to the 2 men sitting near us. We did not want to keep paying for more parking time due to her lack of attention as we had already been there for a while and the restaurant wasn't very busy since we having a fairly early dinner. 

The food was delicious though. It was a mothers day menu and I ordered the Jumbo Shrimp and Chicken Pad See Ew and the boyfriend got the Beef Drunken Noodles. They were great portions and I had leftovers to take with me. The calamari was hot and yummy! My photo for calamari was taken after I ate half of it so there's quite a good bit that they give. They were decently priced for what you get and the ingredients seemed to be great quality. Overall, I would come back and hopefully get someone else as a waiter who would be more attentive.

photos.caption: Jumbo Shrimp and Chicken Pad See Ewe

comment.text: Cozy place and very friendly staffs. We have about an hour to dine before heading to the symphony. Not super hungry but needed something good . We got 4 appetizers, 1 main , 2 old fashioned and 2 soft drinks. For appetizers- chicken satay, Thai dumplings, Roti Curry and street style grilled pork. For the main my hub and I split surf and turf panang. All in all everything taste good but nothing blew our mind.  Fried Lobster in panang wasn't that great very hard and chewy...way too cooked. Our waiter was awesome though . He took note that we have time limit , so the food and drinks  came out very quickly. Our bill  has 18% gratuity already added which I was surprised since we are a small group of 2 adults and 2 kids. So with tax and gratuity the total is $300 ish. Yup..

Ambiance: I came here for my cousin's bachelor party dinner. We were seated upstairs and there seemed to be plenty of room for indoor seatings. Our service was great but some items can take a bit longer, like my pineapple boat.

Taste test: Everyone enjoyed their dishes. We got appetizers from egg rolls to wontons, and it was all good. My pineapple boat was delicious with a good balance of the meat and pineapple. The flavor of the chicken was tender and flavorful.

I have enjoyed the excellent food here since they opened. Due to Covid I have only eaten outside or taken out. Tonight we came to eat inside for the first time in three years. I was excited. I told the person who seated us. Unfortunately we were initially offered a table next to the exit. The woman saw my face and ultimately my request for another table. She gave us one of many other tables available. The room never filled past 50 %, yet the next guest after us was again offered the worst seat. I totally enjoyed the food and our waiter but am deeply disappointed by the seating.

My first time at 26 Thai Kitchen & Bar will likely be my last. My experience was a complete letdown from beginning to end. My husband and I were invited to a birthday dinner and when I tell you our experience was subpar from beginning to end, it is NOT an understatement.

My gripe begins with parking. When we pulled up to the restaurant, we saw that there was a lot next door. It seemed full. I called the host to inquire about parking and she couldn't provide much insight other than, "there's a lot next door." There is no valet (which there should be for more sufficient parking) and there were several spots that could have been used for parking if the restaurant had a functioning valet system, but I digress. We found parking a couple of blocks away.

When we arrived, there were two hosts. Instead of one of them showing us to our party, the host informed us of where the dinner was. Nice. We sat down and our waiter, Joe walked in, realized the entire party still wasn't seated, and walked back out. I would have liked to order a drink at 8 months pregnant, but he left before we could even beckon for him to come over.

On to the food...we ordered the Exclusive 26 Thai Platter deluxe, which included the Soft-shell Crab with sweet Thai chili sauce, Sai Oua which was pork sausage with red onion, fresh ginger, sticky rice, and peanuts, and Street- Style (grilled) Pork. Out of the three, the Street-Style Pork was THE BEST, followed by the Sai Oua. The Soft-shell Crab rendition was not good. It tasted like it hadn't been properly cleaned, to be quite honest. Try at your own discretion.

Since I'm 8 months pregnant, I inquired about the mocktails. While our waiter didn't have any suggestions, I requested something "fruity." I'm not sure what was in it. It was good but it was better when I poured my sparkling water into it. The drink was very syrupy, however, it seemed like all the drinks were mainly syrup infused. The drinks are not made with fresh ingredients, so if you don't like sugary cocktails, I would stick to wine or a neat drink.

For mains, we ordered the Sea Scallops and See Klong Moo (BBQ pork spare ribs). The Sea Scallops were battered, which was a new take on scallops for me and had the 26 Thai sweet chili signature sauce with battered eggplant and green beans and sticky rice. To me, this dish seemed more like an appetizer. The sweet chili sauce becomes a bit overwhelming after the third scallop. Also, if I had known that the entire meal would be battered, I wouldn't have ordered it. The See Klong Moo however, was delicious. The ribs were cooked to perfection and were fall off the bone GOOD!

The evening proceeded with Joe acting seemingly annoyed with our party, for whatever reason. People were already seated when we arrived, so I'm not sure if he was annoyed that everyone wasn't there all at once or if he was taking his bad day out on us, but he did everything from disgruntledly removing dishes from our table to not putting the cake back in the box for us (even though he wrapped everything else for us.) Dear Joe, I apologize for any inconvenience we may have caused you on Saturday night. In the future, please let guests know if you're having a bad day. We know restaurants are understaffed and employees feel overworked, I promise compassion goes a long way and we would have understood.

I wish I'd had a better experience, but between the food and the service, I just have to say the experience was not good and I wouldn't recommend it to friends or family.

Taste? Not bad.  Dish size?  On the small side.  Pricey?  Yep.  Growing up in the DC area with a mecca of Asian food (even had some pad thai at a place where she beat Bobby Flay), I've been eating thai for many years.  Is this place fancy and somewhere you can bring a date?  Yes!  But for a casual lunch among coworkers, this place was easily double what I wanted to spend for lunch.  So, if you want a fancy place to bring a date and enjoy some thai food, this is it!

Cozy Ambiance. Authentic Thai Food. Great Service. Weeknight Date Night. A+ 
Well worth the money and experience
Food was great! We had the wings and crab rolls for apps and then the beef drunken noodles and short rib noodles for entrees. We'll definitely be back!
Another of my favorite Thai food restaurants in Midtown ATL! Service is always great! The coziness is always good! Make reservations early and often! Highly recommended.

The restaurant is large and empty and I figured out why. Everything from the drinks to the appetizers to the food was highly overpriced with it just so so portions and flavors nothing special here.

With so many good Thai restaurants only a couple exits up on Buford Highway I would suggest you avoid this place unless you want to pay an arm and a leg for something you can get for half the price and much better somewhere else

I so badly wanted to give this place 4 stars- the food quality is objectively between 4-5 stars. But both items were missing main ingredients (potatoes and carrots in the curry, eggplant in the entree) and the portion size wasn't made up for the lack thereof. I might try another dish but I hate feeling ripped off.

The service was the best part about being here, thank you sterling!! The chicken satay and wings had pretty good flavor but they were so dry I didn't get to enjoy either of them. I didn't want the server to be charged for them or anything so I just moved on to the spring rolls that clearly came out of a frozen box, and not a good one. They were soggy and had no flavor. My friend got some pad Thai it was cold by the time we got it lol but it wasn't too peanuty so I enjoyed that. The hottest spice level, spicy basil rice wasn't spicy and that was my final reason of the day. I had to go home and think about my frivolous spending and I never regret it when it's food!! I tried to get drunk to not care but the bar was weak too

Best Thai food ever! The menu here exposed me to tastes and dishes that I have not tried before within Thai cuisine. I love the ambiance and decor too -- very classy and nice without feeling pretentious. Can't recommend this place enough and will be telling everyone I know visiting Atlanta about it. 

Everything we ordered was incredible. My favorite was the Exclusive 26 Thai Platter Deluxe appetizer that came with 3 dishes to share -- all 3 of them were so delicious. The 5 Hour Short Rib was my boyfriend's favorite, he was impressed that it was so tender and flavorful! 
The desserts also really blew us away. Both the 26 Spring Roll and Thai Tea Creme Brulee were so unique and amazing. I can't emphasize enough how much you need to get both and not just one!! 

I can't wait to come back to Atlanta just to eat here (probably multiple times) :)

photos.caption: Exclusive 26 Thai Platter Deluxe  Top Left: Soft shell crab Bottom Left: Sai oua (pork sausage) Right: Street-Style Pork Plate

comment.text: Abhorrent service. Tasty food. Our server Max was inappropriate, rude, and sarcastic and ruined our dining experience. It all made sense once my companion and I noticed the mandatory gratuity added to the bill. Really disgusting guy. I do not recommend dining in.
Saturday evening and craved Thai food! Decided to order in and food was delivered quick, fresh and tasty. I ordered chicken pad Thai and wings. Would recommend, next time I'll try dinning in.

Food was great! However, it did come out pretty quick though. (As if pre-made) The only disappointment was the actual service from bartender coming over to service tables as well. The gratuity of 18% for a party of one was epic and undeserved. At arrival it seemed like she was attempting to pressure some of the higher priced entree's and drinks on me. As whatever she could do to up the gratuity. Me being completely unaware of, I still noticed her mediocre service and lack of care to help. Obviously she knew the tip was already included so it seemed no need to bother and provide great service. Noticing her be so busy doing nothing at the bar was unthoughtful. As many times I was assisted by other waitresses (in the seating area) to get help with things I needed. I honestly left there feeling very glad I didn't order any add-ons.

So this is a place I can absolutely see myself becoming a regular at. The food, the drinks, the vibe, give it all to me. 

Let's get into it!

Location and Parking

They have multiple locations throughout the city. I have been to the midtown location as well as the Brookhaven location. The Brookhaven location is located in the Town Brookhaven Plaza, a super convenient plaza that boasts a Costco, Publix, LA Fitness, and a few other really good retail shops and eateries. There is free parking all around, it can get crowded so make sure you grab a spot as soon as you see one. 

At the midtown location there is a lot a few doors down that is paid valet on Friday and Saturday, but it is also shared with a few of the other restaurants that are on the same strip, Babs and Sivas.  There is also a paid lot located behind the restaurant on Peachtree Street. It can easily get crowded in either of these lots so Uber might be a good option to consider.

Reservations, Venue, and Atmosphere

I did not have a reservation at either location I went to, but they do take reservations so depending on when you plan on coming I would suggest calling ahead. Even though they are the same restaurant the venues gave completely different styles and vibes, which I absolutely loved. The Brookhaven location had a bohemian style vibe, the decor was vibrant but still very true to the Thai style. There is booth, and table seating as well as seating at the sushi and regular bar. They also have a nice sized patio that I will definitely be sitting on this summer. The atmosphere is casual and comfortable.

The Midtown location is located on Juniper street, a few doors away from Sivas lounge. The decor here is a stark contrast from Brookhaven, but it is still absolutely beautiful. It is more dimly lit, giving a nice date and city vibe. The walls are painted in dark greens as well as whites, and they also have table and booth seating. There is also an upstairs area, and they have patio seating in front which gives you a great street view. 

Food and drinks

I had the old fashioned at the Brookhaven location, and it was so good I also tried it at the Midtown location. Both times a clear win. 

For appetizers we I tried something different each time. At the Brookhaven location I had the roti massaman, which comes with roti bread, massaman curry, potato, and carrot. The curry was so flavorful, and the bread was warm and soft. For dinner I had the basil fried rice. It was flavorful with just the right amount of spice. 

At midtown I had the 26 Thai Platter, where you select four appetizers to share. My partner and I got the chicken satay, the street style pork, shrimp rolls, and the crispy dumpling. They each came with their own sauce, but my partner and I dipped them in everything and they were all amazing. The appetizers were filling enough that we didn't even need to order mains. 

Service

The service at both location was absolutely amazing. My servers were knowledgeable as well as personable, checked on us often and made great conversation with us. Both our food and drinks came out quickly, I have absolutely no complaints.

Verdict
I have absolutely enjoyed myself both times that I've come here and I can't wait to go back with friends, or my partner. If you love Thai food and a great atmosphere you should absolutely drop in to either location. You'll be so glad you did. 

Until next time!

Came to 26 Thai for lunch and the food was so delicious. I had the massaman chicken.. it did not disappoint. Coworkers had drunken noodles and I think Thai basil or something Ike that. I'd definitely return... especially if I don't have to pay. They were quite pricey, but Worth every cent!!

I want to bring my husband or come with gfs. 

Please check them out!! You won't be disappointed!!
Having a great impromptu dinner!!! Excellent customer service!! The apps were amazing!!! The Thai ambience is strong!!! Cute date spot! Music is bumpin!
26 Thai never disappoints and the Basil fried rice is a staple at when I come here. Service is always friendly, knowledgeable, and efficient.
Was good.  Can't go wrong wit Thai.  Thin this was the place I got lobster pho but that wasn't that great. It was ok
Amazing food, great service, lovely ambiance. I would highly recommend this for a date night or friends link up. The chicken wings, thai steak and eye of the tiger drink was incredible.

Nice little Thai restaurant in Midtown. We decided to sit outside on the front deck to enjoy the nice weather. Wasn't too many people out there.  
26 Thai platter - calamari, crab cheese rolls, shrimp in a blanket were all good. 
See klong moo was nice and tender - didn't even need a butter knife. Making this spicier would make it my favorite dish. 
Gonna order the Bangkok boat noodle the next time with an iced cold Singha lager.

What a cute spot this restaurant is spanning two levels of a big house in midtown. We came here Christmas Day for a lazy dinner and the food and service were impeccable. Best flavors and outstanding service. Highly recommend.

Went here with some friends and their family members on a Sunday night. Decor was very tasteful and nice. Service was pleasant and attentive.

We ordered a number of appetizers and entrees, all of which were quite solid. The appetizers were pretty overpriced though with portions being on the smaller end.

The entrees were fantastic. One highlight was the Rama Chicken - chicken was juicy and curry was rich and flavorful, albeit a bit on the sweeter end. My friend commented that the 5 Hour Short Rib was incredible.

We also tried the Yin Yang dessert - the cake was moist and the coconut ice cream paired well with it.

Although most of the dishes were priced on the higher end, our entire party really enjoyed our experience here.

This is a must do restaurant for anyone in or visiting mid-town Atlanta. The food is incredible. The atmosphere the same. Definitely done by an Interior Designer or Architect. I will return and highly recommend it.

photos.caption: This is a must visit when in Atlanta!

comment.text:
Amazing, amazing, amazing!!! This place has been on my list for a while and I finally got the chance to visit. Me and three of my friends went here for lunch 11/12/2021. There's a parking lot located a few feet past the building on Juniper St for $2.60 for 2-3 hours. Inside and outside seating available. We decide to sit outside since it was a beautiful day. The waiter was super sweet and very helpful, I think her name was Mrs. Emma. 

Now on to the food...we took advantage of the 4 small plate for $30. We ordered the crab cheese rolls, dumplings, shrimp in a blanket, and signature wings sweet chili. All were amazing but I have to say that my favorites were the dumplings and crab cheese rolls. 

For our entrees we're ordered vegetable potstickers off the small plate menu, chicken Kao soi, whole red snapper, and the pineapple boat. I personally had the Kao Soi and it was delicious. The snapper had a really fishy smell but tasted good. My friend that had the pineapple boat said that the chicken was hard and had them remake it with shrimp only, but also stated that it was good. 

To be honest, you can go here and eat off the small plate menu and be in heaven or you can order an entree. Either way, you won't be disappointed. 

Now one thing I would not recommend is the drinks. They were not strong.

photos.caption: Dumplings Plate, Crab Cheese Rolls Plate

comment.text: Celebrated a family member's birthday there. My first time was amazing! The food was really enjoyable. Every one loved it! Staff were very friendly. Planning on returning soon.

Absolutely OBSESSED with this place! Was served by Joe, who was so charismatic and great at providing is quick service. Got basil rolls and wings as appetizers, along with a basil gai meal. Everything was cooked to complete perfection and I'm SO glad to be living just a few minutes walk away!

This is my favorite Thai place in Atlanta so far! I've been a couple times now and I've always been pleased with the food. I've never gotten anything I disliked except maybe this one sausage special Thai dish (see my pics)... that was quite interesting. Would not recommend if you're not used to more ethnic Thai cuisine. 

My favorite was definitely the Kao Soi which is under their "Thai Favorites". The crispy noodles soak into the curry sauce and then you can add a fried chicken cutlet on top. The portions are also great for sharing or if you're just getting for yourself, it can feed a small Asian girl for two meals. 

The service has never been a problem for me, parking is a hit or miss along the street, and the inside is quite modern and sleek. There's sometimes a wait here but if you're okay with bar seating, that's much quicker! Otherwise there are always reservations.

How cute was this place that was in a converted home. I loved the decor and vibe, the tables are a lil tight so not a lot of privacy. The food was amazing , they made a bomb margarita and I had a Thai iced tea #yum Cute  date night or girls night out spot.

photos.caption: Pad See Ewe with chicken and shrimp

comment.text: We've always wanted to try this spot and we chose the right day. The environment was very nice and they weren't too busy. Our waitress Isa was great and gave good feedback on the selections. We had the 26 Thai platter and it was great. We had calamari, sesame sweet chili wings, shrimp in a blanket, and spring rolls and every selection was great. We also had the Tum Tom Yum soup and it was quite tasty. Overall, we really enjoyed the vibe, the food, and the service. We will definitely return. They also have additional seating upstairs.

26 Thai - Midtown was absolutely delicious! We were immediately greeted by the host and seated within seconds. Our server, Mark, provided beyond exceptional service. He was very informative and his recommendations were spot on! My husband and I were awed by the ambiance of the restaurant. From the food to the music, it was a true experience! If you're ever in the Midtown area be sure to stop by and ask for Mark!
I like the gastronomy of this restaurant. Everything we ordered impressed us with the presentation and taste. Their service was good too and provided nice suggestions.

The place was beautiful and had a wonderful ambiance, there was seating outside which was very nice. The service was was also really good, our waitress was very enthusiastic. The food was delicous!! I had curry and it was very good. The portion sizing was pretty good, the plates are just big enough to fill you up without being uncomfortable. I will say that this is a little on the expensive side but I think it's worth it.
This was our first time here. We had the platter of 5 dishes. The presentation was nice. Our waitress Gabby was on point. Will be back.

Listen, this restaurant has the BEST food I've ever had. The service not so much! If the business say it closes at 10, then you close at 10. You don't stop taking people at 9:30. I eat here about 2-3x a week. So imagine being in the restaurant and the General Manager turns lights on and begins to kick people out at 10 pm! This is ridiculous! I'm only giving it 2 stars cause the food is consistent. I will never go back here! Check my video below.
Great food and staff.  I highly recommend coming early and sitting at the bar.  The bar area is the best
